lines.text: Enter VALENTINE and SPEED

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Sir, your glove.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Not mine my gloves are on.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Why, then, this may be yours, for this is but one.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Ha! let me see: ay, give it me, its mine: Sweet ornament that decks a thing divine! Ah, Silvia, Silvia!

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Madam Silvia! Madam Silvia!

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: How now, sirrah

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: She is not within hearing, sir.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Why, sir, who bade you call her

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Your worship, sir or else I mistook.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Well, youll still be too forward.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: And yet I was last chidden for being too slow.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Go to, sir: tell me, do you know Madam Silvia

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: She that your worship loves

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Why, how know you that I am in love

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Marry, by these special marks: first, you have learned, like Sir Proteus, to wreathe your arms, like a malecontent to relish a lovesong, like a robinredbreast to walk alone, like one that had the pestilence to sigh, like a schoolboy that had lost his A B C to weep, like a young wench that had buried her grandam to fast, like one that takes diet to watch like one that fears robbing to speak puling, like a beggar at Hallowmas. You were wont, when you laughed, to crow like a cock when you walked, to walk like one of the lions when you fasted, it was presently after dinner when you looked sadly, it was for want of money: and now you are metamorphosed with a mistress, that, when I look on you, I can hardly think you my master.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Are all these things perceived in me

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: They are all perceived without ye.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Without me they cannot.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Without you nay, thats certain, for, without you were so simple, none else would: but you are so without these follies, that these follies are within you and shine through you like the water in an urinal, that not an eye that sees you but is a physician to comment on your malady.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: But tell me, dost thou know my lady Silvia

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: She that you gaze on so as she sits at supper

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Hast thou observed that even she, I mean.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Why, sir, I know her not.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Dost thou know her by my gazing on her, and yet knowest her not

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Is she not hardfavoured, sir

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Not so fair, boy, as wellfavoured.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Sir, I know that well enough.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: What dost thou know

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: That she is not so fair as, of you, wellfavoured.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I mean that her beauty is exquisite, but her favour infinite.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Thats because the one is painted and the other out of all count.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: How painted and how out of count

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Marry, sir, so painted, to make her fair, that no man counts of her beauty.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: How esteemest thou me I account of her beauty.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: You never saw her since she was deformed.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: How long hath she been deformed

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Ever since you loved her.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I have loved her ever since I saw her and still I see her beautiful.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: If you love her, you cannot see her.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Why

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Because Love is blind. O, that you had mine eyes or your own eyes had the lights they were wont to have when you chid at Sir Proteus for going ungartered!

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: What should I see then

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Your own present folly and her passing deformity: for he, being in love, could not see to garter his hose, and you, being in love, cannot see to put on your hose.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Belike, boy, then, you are in love for last morning you could not see to wipe my shoes.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: True, sir I was in love with my bed: I thank you, you swinged me for my love, which makes me the bolder to chide you for yours.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: In conclusion, I stand affected to her.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: I would you were set, so your affection would cease.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Last night she enjoined me to write some lines to one she loves.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: And have you

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I have.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Are they not lamely writ

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: No, boy, but as well as I can do them. Peace! here she comes.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: [Aside]  O excellent motion! O exceeding puppet! Now will he interpret to her.
Enter SILVIA

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Madam and mistress, a thousand goodmorrows.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: [Aside]  O, give ye good even! heres a million of manners.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Sir Valentine and servant, to you two thousand.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: [Aside]  He should give her interest and she gives it him.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: As you enjoind me, I have writ your letter Unto the secret nameless friend of yours Which I was much unwilling to proceed in But for my duty to your ladyship.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: I thank you gentle servant: tis very clerkly done.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Now trust me, madam, it came hardly off For being ignorant to whom it goes I writ at random, very doubtfully.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Perchance you think too much of so much pains

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: No, madam so it stead you, I will write Please you command, a thousand times as much And yet

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: A pretty period! Well, I guess the sequel And yet I will not name it and yet I care not And yet take this again and yet I thank you, Meaning henceforth to trouble you no more.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: [Aside]  And yet you will and yet another yet.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: What means your ladyship do you not like it

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Yes, yes the lines are very quaintly writ But since unwillingly, take them again. Nay, take them.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Madam, they are for you.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Ay, ay: you writ them, sir, at my request But I will none of them they are for you I would have had them writ more movingly.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Please you, Ill write your ladyship another.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: And when its writ, for my sake read it over, And if it please you, so if not, why, so.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: If it please me, madam, what then

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Why, if it please you, take it for your labour: And so, good morrow, servant.
Exit

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: O jest unseen, inscrutable, invisible, As a nose on a mans face, or a weathercock on a steeple! My master sues to her, and she hath taught her suitor, He being her pupil, to become her tutor. O excellent device! was there ever heard a better, That my master, being scribe, to himself should write the letter

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: How now, sir what are you reasoning with yourself

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Nay, I was rhyming: tis you that have the reason.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: To do what

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: To be a spokesman for Madam Silvia.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: To whom

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: To yourself: why, she wooes you by a figure.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: What figure

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: By a letter, I should say.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Why, she hath not writ to me

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: What need she, when she hath made you write to yourself Why, do you not perceive the jest

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: No, believe me.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: No believing you, indeed, sir. But did you perceive her earnest

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: She gave me none, except an angry word.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Why, she hath given you a letter.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Thats the letter I writ to her friend.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: And that letter hath she delivered, and there an end.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I would it were no worse.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Ill warrant you, tis as well: For often have you writ to her, and she, in modesty, Or else for want of idle time, could not again reply Or fearing else some messenger that might her mind discover, Herself hath taught her love himself to write unto her lover. All this I speak in print, for in print I found it. Why muse you, sir tis dinnertime.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I have dined.

lines.speaker: speed
lines.text: Ay, but hearken, sir though the chameleon Love can feed on the air, I am one that am nourished by my victuals, and would fain have meat. O, be not like your mistress be moved, be moved.
Exeunt
